title: Spanish Level I
description: A beginning Spanish course with emphasis on communicative skills (listening and speaking), literacy skills (reading and writing) and culture. CTL:IWL 1910 Spanish Level I

title: Spanish Level II
description: Continuation of SPAN 10100. CTL:IWL 1911 Spanish Level II

title: Accelerated Basic Spanish
description: Accelerated Basic Spanish course that substitutes for SPAN 10100 and 10200.

title: Spanish Level III
description: An intermediate Spanish course with emphasis on communicative skills (listening and speaking), literacy skills (reading and writing) and culture. CTL:IWL 1912 Spanish Level III

title: Spanish Level IV
description: Continuation of SPAN 20100. CTL:IWL 1913 Spanish Level IV

title: Introduction To The Study Of Hispanic Literature
description: Reading and discussion of selected poetry, prose, and theatre from Spain and Spanish-speaking America; introduction to critical discourse and basic concepts of literary theory. Texts, discussion, and written assignments in Spanish.

title: Spanish Level V
description: Continued development of Spanish speaking, listening, reading, and writing abilities, using materials dealing primarily with everyday life and civilization in the Spanish-speaking countries from a variety of sources (e.g., newspapers, magazines, TV, recent literature, etc.). Conducted primarily in Spanish.

title: Spanish Level VI
description: Further work to develop speaking, listening, reading, and writing abilities in Spanish on the basis of materials dealing with the ideas and events that have shaped the present-day Spanish-speaking countries. Conducted primarily in Spanish.

title: Spanish For Heritage Speakers
description: This course is intended for the student whose home language is Spanish, but whose education has been exclusively in English. The students will first learn to read and write their native dialects and then the standard language using the orthographic norms of the standard language.

title: Introduction To Spanish For The Professions
description: Continued work at the advanced-intermediate level with a focus on vocabulary and grammar for contexts in a wide variety of professional settings. Conducted primarily in Spanish.

title: Spanish For The Health Professions
description: Intermediate level course directed towards the use of Spanish in the health care professions. It covers specialized vocabulary from the medical fields, as well as grammar and syntax with the goal of developing speaking, listening, reading and writing abilities. Students will have the opportunity to apply their skills in practical contexts and discuss cultural considerations.

title: Spanish For Engineering And Technology
description: This is an intermediate-level course directed towards the use of Spanish in Engineering and Technology professions. It covers specialized vocabulary from the different technical areas, as well as grammar and syntax, with the goal of developing speaking, listening, reading, and writing abilities. Students will have the opportunity to apply their skills in practical contexts, including job interviews, internships, formal presentations and communication in the workplace.

title: Hispanic Literature I: Poetry And Drama
description: Reading of selected poetic and dramatic texts from Spain and Spanish-speaking America in their historical and cultural contexts. Readings, discussion, and papers in Spanish.

title: The Structure Of Spanish I: Phonetics And Phonology
description: Linguistic analysis of Spanish phonology, phonetics, and dialectology. Selected topics within the areas of Spanish sociolinguistics and language acquisition. Each of these topics will be approached from a contrastive Spanish/English perspective. One session per week devoted to pronunciation improvement.

title: Spanish Level VII
description: Advanced work on development of Spanish speaking, listening, reading, and writing abilities, focusing on materials dealing primarily with culture and the arts in the Spanish-speaking countries. Conducted primarily in Spanish.

title: Spanish Level VIII
description: Spanish 40200 is a content-based course that includes an overview of Spanish grammar. Students will therefore be required to learn a considerable amount of information about the different aspects of the Hispanic, Peninsular and Latin American culture that will include history, politics, art, gastronomy, music, traditions, and literature, among others.

title: Spanish Translation And Interpreting
description: Introduction to the Translation and Interpretation Studies field for Spanish speakers. High level of competence in Spanish required. Overview of translation theory, methodology, and practice both in class and in real settings. Includes a service learning component. Conducted in English and Spanish.

title: Business Spanish
description: A study of the terminology and techniques used in commercial transactions, including the interpretation and writing of business materials. Development of the four language skills, with emphasis on writing and speaking.

title: Spanish Culture
description: The development of the cultural life of the Spanish people as reflected in the geography, history, music, art, and architecture of Spain. Lectures in Spanish.

title: Latin American Civilization
description: Outline of Latin American history; the cultural heritage from Spain and from the pre-Spanish civilizations; the intellectual, social, and cultural progress of the Latin American countries. Lectures in Spanish.

title: Latin American Culture
description: Study of Latin American cultures and U.S. Latino culture, from pre-Columbian times to the present. The course will focus on selected aspects of the cultures of Latin American groups. Conducted in Spanish.

title: Teaching College Spanish
description: A course designed to provide a forum for ideas connecting theory and research to teaching practice. Explores issues related to how learning and teaching can be enhanced and presents practical ideas that can be implemented in the classroom. Permission of instructor required.

title: Spanish American Literature Of The Colonial Period
description: A survey of Spanish American literature of the colonial period. Reading and discussion of a number of representative works as well as excerpts from several others.

title: Spanish Sociolinguistics
description: This course addresses the linguistic variation found at all linguistic levels of Spanish (e.g., phonetics, morphology, syntax) that is explained through social variation (e.g., socio-economic status, race, gender). Regional varieties of Spanish in Latin America, the U.S., and Peninsular societies will be studied. Related topics are style and identity, language attitudes, discourse analysis, and pragmatics. All classes will be conducted in Spanish.

title: Fundamentals Of Morphology
description: Topics vary. Permission of instructor required.

title: Bibliography And Literary Criticism
description: The use of general and specific reference materials and bibliographical aids in literary research; the basic concepts and terminology of literary criticism. Required of all MA candidates in Spanish.

title: Latin American Theater
description: Advanced study of special subject. Topics to be announced in advance. Content varies. Permission of instructor required.

title: Classroom SLA
description: Advanced study and research on a significant topic in Spanish linguistics. Topic to be announced in advance. Permission of instructor required.
